text:
Hi <@U04EJHVD8FM>,
Is it possible to display an iframe (such as the wikipedia web page) in a card without needed to click a button ?
Hi <@U0603EE497T> LineChart and BarChart is now <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C05R599UA12/p1728416124797749|available>
Hi <@UGDF9EBPW>, LineChart and BarChart are now available:sprocket-dance:<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C05R599UA12/p1728416124797749| More details here>
Following up here: LineChart and BarChart are now <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C05R599UA12/p1728416124797749|available>:HubSpot:
Soooo excited! Saw the video of Brooke. This is going to solve a lot of different use cases for us.
Awesome! So glad to hear it:star-struck:

I'm also trying a different approach using multiple apps in one project, but I would need to be able to deploy them separately, is that possible?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CLJJXGTC0/p1728505788591199>
Unfortunately no not at the moment, each upload of a project creates a new build and then a specific build can be triggered for deployment, but it would potentially contain changes for multiple apps.
Once an app is migrated to a Project via CLI, is it possible to revert it like it was before? managed via HubSpot page as opposed to CLI?

Technically yes it can be done by deleting the project associated with it, but we support all of the functionality and more after migration so it should not be necessary. If you want to test the migration, I'd recommend using the `hs project clone-app` command to essentially preview what it would be before running the migration command.

When connecting GitHub to a project, could I have multiple projects in my repo and pick one?
```MyRepo
 - Project 1
   - hspeoject.json
  - Project 2
    - hsproject.json```
If I have a repo with a folder structure like the one above, could I pick just Project 1 to sync?

I believe our integration requires the repo/branch as part of configuration and that has to be unique between linked projects. So you could have the same repo with different branches but not the same for all 3.

I migrated an app for testing and don't want to maintain the configs on my repo. So I kind want to start over with the right app. So deleting the project, should technically bring the app back how it was before, right?
got it. thanks for the info.

<@U056ZR8LVJQ> in your experience, if a company like ours that uses 3 different apps for different environments (dev, staging and production), what would be the best way to migrate those to use the Project framework and build public UI extensions?

Like, we do have 3 apps, but other than some secrets and auth redirect URL, they are basically the same thing. But, they will have to share the UI extensions components. I'm having a hard time find a viable solution to migrate those apps and build extensions. They can't be in the same project otherwise they are deployed together.

This is a problem we are looking into solving more elegantly in the next couple quarters. If you have access to more sophisticated CI/CD tools, you could automate some of the shared code between subdirectories (each representing a unique project/app) and the upload process there instead of directly from via the CLI.
